bio:
Eddie Opara was born in London in 1972 and studied graphic design at the London College of Printing and Yale University, where he received his MFA. He began his graphic design career at ATG and Imaginary Forces and was later an art director at the influential design studio 2x4. In 2005 he founded his own firm, The Map Office, in New York.

Eddie is a multi-faceted designer whose work encompasses brand identity, publications, environments, interactive installations, websites, user interfaces and software, with many of his projects ranging across multiple media. He has developed numerous applications including the MiG, an innovative content and asset management system for off and online applications that is curretnly in use by various clientele.

Eddie's clients include the Menil Foundation, the Studio Museum in Harlem, Jazz at Lincoln Center, JWT, St. Regis Hotels, the Corcoran Group, New York University, UCLA, Grimshaw Architects, Harry N. Abrams and Princeton Architectural Press.

Eddie's work has been recognized by the American Institute of Graphic Arts and Art Directors Club. He has widely lectured on design issues and taught at many leading universities such as the Rhode Island School of Design, Yale University and Columbia University. He is presently a visiting critic at Yale University and is Master Lecturer at the University of the Arts in Philadelphia and is also serving on the board of the New York Chapter of AIGA.

In 2010 he joined Pentagram's New York office as partner.
